Reviews:
Sarah Smith
2 reviews
Rated 2.0 out of 5,
Therapist didn’t seem to really know what he was doing. Asked for a strong massage, didn’t really get as much strength as was needed. Went because my regular massage place was booked out and I was walking in pain with a very obvious knot in my foot arch - am a dancer so I need to be able to move about pain free. The therapist not only did not seem to feel the knot, he barely touched it, did not release it at all. It was all very cursory, I may as well not have gone for the foot reflex in the first place. Could have done a better job at home releasing it myself. Will not be going back. Waste of time and money.

Christine Fong
5 reviews
Rated 5.0 out of 5,
Clean and no frills massage place. Did the half an hour back massage and Uncle Heng really knows exactly how to work the knots out without me telling him where. Will definitely go back again!

HR Kang
1 review
Rated 5.0 out of 5,
Amazed by professional massage. The old lady customized her massage by finding right spot and strong pressure. I was totally healed by her great skill. She is also very kind and understanding. So i visited twice during my short biz trip.

Jennifer Chen
15 reviews·8 photos
Rated 5.0 out of 5,
I went to this place before jumping on a 13hr flight and I’m so glad I did! I’ve had tight back muscles all my life and never had it properly loosened from a massage (all the others were just painful but weren’t very effective). Great technique, I wish I could find similar elsewhere. Highly recommend and I’ll be back every time I stop over in SG!

(Translated by Google) A casual massage shop. The person in the shop is kind and has good skills. The price is also conscientious. It seems that it has moved to a slightly larger place on the opposite side of the old store on the same floor.
